Aggregate survey points for each type and age group.

Source: R/aggregate_sample_survey.R
aggregate_sample_survey.Rd

Aggregate survey points for each type and age group.

aggregate_sample_survey(
  survey_circumcision,
  areas,
  join = TRUE,
  types = list(Total = c(unique(survey_circumcision$type)), Medical = "MMC",
    Traditional = "TMC"),
  age_groups = c("0-4", "5-9", "10-14", "15-19", "20-24", "25-29", "30-34", "35-39",
    "40-44", "45-49", "50-54", "54-59", "60-64", "65+", "0+", "10+", "15+", "15-24",
    "15-29", "15-39", "15-49", "10-29", "10-39", "10-49", "10-24")
)

Arguments

survey_circumcision

Information on male circumcision status from surveys.

areas

sf shapefiles which include area hierarchies.

join

Indicator to decide whether to join aggregated samples for different age groups, Default: TRUE

types

List of circumcision types to look at, Default: list("Total" = c(unique(survey_circumcision$type)), "Medical" = "MMC", "Traditional" = "TMC")

age_groups

Age groups to aggregate by, Default: c("0-4", "5-9", "10-14", "15-19", "20-24", "25-29", "30-34", "35-39", "40-44", "45-49", "50-54", "54-59", "0+", "10+", "15+", "15-24", "10-24", 15-29", "10-29", "15-39", "10-39", "15-49", "10-49")

Value

data.frame with samples aggregated by aggr_cols and weighted by population.

See also

combine_areas
